content.description: The campaign manager for a candidate for governor wants to estimate the difference between the percentage of voters who viewed an advertisement and favor the candidate and the percentage of voters who had not viewed the advertisement and favor the candidate. Two independent random samples of <math alttext="500" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> voters were selected. One random sample consisted of voters who viewed the advertisement and the other random sample consisted of voters who had not viewed the advertisement. The table shows the frequencies of responses for those surveyed.
content.question: Have Not Seen Advertisement Have Seen Advertisement In favor <math alttext="224" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>224</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="283" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>283</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Not in favor <math alttext="276" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>276</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="217" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>217</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Which of the following is the most appropriate method for the campaign manager to use to estimate the difference between the percentages of voters who favor the candidate?

choices.label: A one-sample <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for estimating a population proportion
A <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for estimating the slope of the least-squares regression line
A matched-pairs <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for estimating a mean difference
A two-sample <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for estimating a difference between sample proportions
A two-sample <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for estimating a difference between population proportions

content.answer: A two-sample <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for estimating a difference between population proportions
